body_html:
Yes this would make it easier to analyze the graph that is loaded :)
…
On Aug 11, 2017 8:47 PM, "loki der quaeler" ***@***.***> wrote: @borissmidt <https://github.com/borissmidt> So it sounds like you're asking for List<Operation> getOperations (); to be added to org.tensorflow.Graph Which would entail, @asimshankar <https://github.com/asimshankar>, (((i think, having looked at the code for the first time this morning))) additionally adding private static native long[] allOperations(long handle); to Graph.java JNIEXPORT jlongArray JNICALL Java_org_tensorflow_Graph_allOperations(JNIEnv *, jclass, jlong); to graph_ini.h In the implementation of that in graph_ini.cc, we'd call a new function to be implemented in c_api, stubbed in the .h as TF_CAPI_EXPORT extern void TF_GraphAllOperations(TF_Graph* graph, TF_Operation** operations); and implemented in the .cc aggregating out of graph->name_map Sound about right? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#12133 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFt8ln-W_pAPDsY_4qdZPlJQRXSnzgyHks5sXKHOgaJpZM4OxyUY> .
body_text:
Yes this would make it easier to analyze the graph that is loaded :)
…
On Aug 11, 2017 8:47 PM, "loki der quaeler" ***@***.***> wrote:
 @borissmidt <https://github.com/borissmidt> So it sounds like you're
 asking for List<Operation> getOperations (); to be added to
 org.tensorflow.Graph

 Which would entail, @asimshankar <https://github.com/asimshankar>, (((i
 think, having looked at the code for the first time this morning)))
 additionally adding
 private static native long[] allOperations(long handle);
 to Graph.java

 JNIEXPORT jlongArray JNICALL Java_org_tensorflow_Graph_allOperations(JNIEnv
 *, jclass, jlong);
 to graph_ini.h

 In the implementation of that in graph_ini.cc, we'd call a new function
 to be implemented in c_api, stubbed in the .h as
 TF_CAPI_EXPORT extern void TF_GraphAllOperations(TF_Graph* graph,
 TF_Operation** operations);
 and implemented in the .cc aggregating out of graph->name_map

 Sound about right?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#12133 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFt8ln-W_pAPDsY_4qdZPlJQRXSnzgyHks5sXKHOgaJpZM4OxyUY>
 .
body:
Yes this would make it easier to analyze the graph that is loaded :)

On Aug 11, 2017 8:47 PM, "loki der quaeler" <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @borissmidt <https://github.com/borissmidt> So it sounds like you're
> asking for List<Operation> getOperations (); to be added to
> org.tensorflow.Graph
>
> Which would entail, @asimshankar <https://github.com/asimshankar>, (((i
> think, having looked at the code for the first time this morning)))
> additionally adding
> private static native long[] allOperations(long handle);
> to Graph.java
>
> JNIEXPORT jlongArray JNICALL Java_org_tensorflow_Graph_allOperations(JNIEnv
> *, jclass, jlong);
> to graph_ini.h
>
> In the implementation of that in graph_ini.cc, we'd call a new function
> to be implemented in c_api, stubbed in the .h as
> TF_CAPI_EXPORT extern void TF_GraphAllOperations(TF_Graph* graph,
> TF_Operation** operations);
> and implemented in the .cc aggregating out of graph->name_map
>
> Sound about right?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/12133#issuecomment-321890077>,
> or mute the thread
